reviews.review: Гра дуже цікава, вперше в неї зіграв в 2007, дуже сподобалась своєю атмосферою, сетингом, персонажами, сюжетом. Рекомендую всім, гра захоплює з перших хвилин. Чудове музичне супроводження не залишить вас байдужим. Гра еталон.
Solid game with an extremely impressive A.I for it's time but sadly the entire game gets dragged down by Xen which is absolute garbage. Overall a solid 8/10

Historia y gameplay intensos, te mantiene en tensión constantemente, doblado correctamente al Castellano, las únicas dos pegas son los inexistentes logros y una jugabilidad algo tosca (pero queda perdonada teniendo en cuenta la época de la que proviene el juego) además de un online muy estable y que funciona hasta en las peores redes 100% recomendado.

First time i played it after a long time it had been released.
A lot of people reccomended me this game, and with good reason, it's a good game, but, i can get ANNOYINGLY frustrated sometimes [spoiler] Basicly from halfway in the game	[/spoiler] but...it was good, how annoyed i got at times, it was still a very enjoyable experiance, but worth all the praise?....Kind of, Now i'm gonna play Half Life 2, According to a lot of people one of the best games ever made, i hope it improves on a lot of the flaws this one had.

Küçükken bu oyunu oynamayı çok istiyodum.Fakat oyun orjinal olmadığı için şerefsiz güvenlik görevlisi kapıyı açmıyodu.Bu zamana nasipmiş bitirmek.Bi düşünün 1998 den önce sadece quake falan var hikaye yok etrafta zıplayıp canavar öldürüyorsunuz ve bi bakmışsınız half life diye oyun çıkmış şimdiki oyunların yakalayamadığı güzellikte senaryosu var zamanına göre çok iyi olan grafikler...   Herkese oyunu bitirmesini tavsiye ederim.Gerçekten başyapıt.

Overall i'm happy i got it and played it so i can tick it off the list. Now i just have to wait for Half-Life thr... oh wait.

Uno de los mejores juegos que he probado nunca.

Estas rebajas me he dado una vuelta por la Tienda, a ver qué había interesante. La verdad, nunca me había acercado demasiado a los juegos de Valve que no fuese el Team Fortress (por eso de ser gratuito) y estaba un poco receloso de adquirir el título. Pero como costaba 99 céntimos, dije que mejor oportunidad que esa no se me iba a presentar.

Al principio pensaba que lo abandonaría rápidamente, pero tan pronto como me metí en la piel de Gordon Freeman y en el traje HEV me sentí como si estuviese en Black Mesa. La ambientación es impresionante, y te mete de cabeza desde que entras en la cámara del reactor. Los enemigos son inteligentes, tienen unos movimientos geniales y todos son originales. La trama es absorbente y los pasillos te hacen sentir realmente pequeño. Lo mejor de todo es que no hay una flecha apuntando todo el rato a donde tienes que ir. Debes encontrar tu propio camino.

Para ser 1998, este juego tiene muchísimas cosas buenas, mejor hechas que las de 2017 incluso. Solo porque tenga unos gráficos "no a la altura de hoy día" no debería echarte hacia atrás. Compra recomendada y obligatoria.

This is one of those games that are just pure proof that graphics don't make the game. This game came out in 1998 and is still better than some games that come out to this day. This (believe it or not) is my first time playing it and I'm having a blast. It's just one of those games that you can't put down. Idk what about it makes it so intriguing or entertaining but it's a very good game either way. Definitely buy this game, especially since all of them are on sale for like $0.99 each, so even if you don't like it (A BIG IF) then it won't be that much of a waste.

Efsaneler ölmez bir zamanlar internet kafelerin dolup taşma sebebiydi bilenler bilir crossfire ve stalkyard en baba haritalarıdır. Oyun 97 yapımı olmasına rağmen hala ölmemiş zaten bi oyun efsane statüsüne erişmiş ise ölmez aga bin yıl (mecaz) dahi geçse anılır. Vefa borcundan dolayı oyunu alma gereği duydum ancak serverların bu denli dolu olup beni eski günlerdeki gibi eğlendireceğini tahmin etmezdim şimdi sıra eski internet kafe müziklerinde :D onunla top yekun bi nostaji yapılabilir...

Half-Life es una obra de arte, Durante mi vida como jugador, nunca me e sentido tan a traido por la historia de un juego, si hay varios
videojuegos que se mueven con mucho dinero y nos dan unas campañas bien asquerosas para mi gusto, a pesar que el juego
fue lanzado ya hace bastante tiempo, se da a entender que sin importar los graficos, te pueden contar una historia muy interesante
y aqui empieza todo, Half-Life se trata sobre ciertos aconteciomientos sucedidos en las instalaciones subterraneas de black mesa.
durante el juego ocuparemos al protagonista de la historia llamado, gordon freedman, era un cientifico investigador que trabajaba 
para las impresas black mesa. donde el se dedicaba a investigar varios materiales misteriosos. durante un experimentos gordon 
abre un portal accidentalmente lo cual lleva el caos y las decesperacion en las instalaciones de black mesa.

Graficamente en sus tiempos era algo next gen, por que a diferencias con los juegos de esa generacion
este presentaban con varios nevedades que ningun otro juego tenia, como mas detalles en textura, interaccion
mas real con las inteligencias artificiales (bot), mejoras en iluminacion y en color, etc.. bueno para que no jugaron
este juego, podran decir que los graficos del juego son mediocres, pero bueno eso no afecta en nada en la jugabilidad.

en jugabilidad muy comoda, como cualquier fps basico. no tiene nada del otro mundo que nos pueda dificular la jugabilidad

En desarrollo de personajes, no cuentan nada sobre gordon, solo sabemos que es un cientifico que trabajaba para black mesa
y a los demas, no se sabe casi nada de ellos, pero vamos, esto no afecta en la historia ya que lo unico que estamos
pendiente del juego es que, ¿Que sucedera con gordon?

y en el soundtrack, todos son memoriables, si son muy pocas los soundtrack reproduccido en el juego pero cada uno te deja una sencacion de emocion 

Unos de los problemas que veo en este juego es que tiene algunos bugs, no se si es por mi pc o el sistema operativo pero si e visto
que a muchos jugadores se le cierra el juego al morir o en cargar partida, la unica recomendacion que les puedo dar es guardar con F6 y al morir presionar rapidamente F7 para volver hasta el ultimo guardado, al menos asi tuve que pasar el juego.

En resumen, este juego es muy recomendable ya que tiene una buena historia que te deja con ganas de seguir jugando
o tratando de saber que sucede despues, lamentablemente en la fecha que escribo esto, aun no esta confirmado el 
desarrollo del del half life 3 pero bueno que se le podra hacer, a esperar.

Nice game but a little old

I liked this game because of how it is so innovative. I really liked the intro, with the [spoiler] tram ride and the resonance cascade [/spoiler]. I also liked how the enemy A.I. works; the [spoiler] troops' [/spoiler] ai is especially fantastic, and was innovative at the time. The story is very well presented and very realistic (No cutscenes with fixed camera). The game holds up really well, despite being almost 20 years old (as of 2017). There are some things that don't hold up very well, such as the graphics being very low-poly. If you liked this game, check out the sequel, Half-Life 2, which has improved on those things. Still, nothing beats the original!

好吧，作为一个萌新，我来谈一下自己完成Half-Life单机部分原作的感受。
（1） 关于晕3D的问题：晕是几乎一定的，但是如果不是长时间卡在某一个地方，是可以得到很大缓解的，请放心食用。[spoiler]吐了我不管，哈哈[/spoiler][spoiler]我先去吐一会的什么是不可能的[/spoiler]
（2）这个中文配音简直了，屌炸天
（3）关卡量很大，分辨率不高，但是我玩得滋滋有味[spoiler]很多地方都卡关，fps苦手[/spoiler]
（4）打折的时候入的，后来发现入了一个大坑
（5）结尾的音乐莫名抖腿啊。。。[spoiler]Credits / Closing Theme (Tracking Device)[/spoiler]
（6）关于远程跳跃的问题，我在这里说一下。远程跳跃需要在向前行走的时候，利用下蹲(Ctrl)和跳跃(space)键位同时按下来触发。但是一般来说，此键位组合与操作系统上的输入法切换热键相冲突。参考网上的解决方法，在键位设置中将v作为候选跳跃键，这样平时使用space来跳跃，而后期需要远程跳跃的时候，在向前走的时候，先按住Ctrl，然后马上按住v，然后将Ctrl和v键都松开，同时保持向前（默认是w键）一直摁着，就可以自如地使用远程跳跃了。

[h1] [strike] Krótka [/strike]Recenzja [/h1]

Gra wydana w 1998 roku. Jak na swoje standardy rewolucyjna. Jest to gra Przygodowa, Sci-Fi, Akcji [b] First Person Shooter [/b].
Posiada 2 zakończenia (Odpowiednie i Alternatywne).
HL przeszedłem w ok. 12h z masą zgonów i głupich akcji. Dla bardziej ogarniętego gracza zajmie krócej. 
Po przejściu po prostu chce się grać w [b] Half Life 2[/b]
Fabularnie bardzo dobra i wciągająca, choć od połowy rozgrywki, miałem w połowie w dupie fabułę i leciałem przed siebie. Dopiero pod koniec gra mnie zaskoczyła i ciągle trzymała w napięciu.
Graficznie jak na 98 rok, REWOLUCJA.
Dzisiaj jest to mniej niż średnio, ale i tak lepiej niż srajkraft. Dla osób, które lubią retro gry - Super.
Soundtrack świetny, choć czasem się buguje.
Jest dostępny do pobrania za darmo na steam.
Bronie i strzelanie z nich jest trudne i to mnie bardzo cieszy [spoiler] w porównaniu do HL2 [/spoiler]. Nawet na poziomie "Łatwy" jest dość trudno.
Postacie oraz przeplatanie się żołnierzy Marine i stworów pochodzących ze świata Xen jest super.
Nie można się nudzić!
Zawsze gdy grozi nam niebezpieczeństwo przychodzi z pomocą nasz przyjaciel ochroniarz!
Zawsze gdy trzeba otworzyć cholerne drzwi, przychodzi z pomocą jeden z naukowców!
Walka z Bossami to nie zwykła nawalanka, ale wymagająca sprytu i pomysłów od gracza, strategiczna potyczka.
Nasz główny bohater niestety milczy i niewypowie nic przez [strike] następną 1 część i epizody [/strike] następne [b] 2 części [/b] i epizody!

I played this 10 years ago and couldn't beat it for the life of me. At age 20 now, I finally beat this game in 16 hours. I highly recommend to any fan of classic FPS games.

Pros:

- Classic nostalgia you won't get anywhere else.
- Great story line, always keeps you curious.

Cons:

- The graphics are horrid, but what do you expect from a 1998 game?
- On hard difficulty, this game will trigger most.

The Bad: Graphics look hideous these days, newer gamers will hate this due to all the flaws that stick out, to many "mazy" levels

Man O' man does this bring back a lot of good memories. I remember almost dying because my mom's computer couldn't run HL1. I begged her to get the computer upgraded (at the time not even knowing how this was possible or the cost) she just wouldn't do it. All I could do was stare at videos and screenshots until I thought would be forever *da-da-da!* until I heard about the PS2 port! I was so excited I babysat my bratty sisters for a whole summer and laid down $200 smackeroonies on a used PS2, but to my luck HL was no where to be seen. It turns out not many copies of the game were made so they were scarce. Settling with a rental I finally was able to play the game, but it was starting to feel old because I didn't get ahold of it until late 2003. Realizing that I was missing out on a lot AT THE TIME I wound up losing my save and being so angry never touched the game again. Four years later I can finally play the game again thanks to Steam (I actually ordered the HL1 Anthology off of EBgames for $20) and I DEFINITELY realized what I missed now that I have finally been able to finish the game.

Half-Life used the Quake II engine at the time which was fighting against the Unreal engine technically. While Half-Life never looked as good as Unreal Valve pulled some strings and did some custom stuff with the physics, water, and lighting effects that wasn't originally in the Q2 engine. HL isn't just your regular run & gun shooter the story is told all in real time by running into certain characters and by just progressing you get an idea of what's going on without much dialog. This was revolutionary at the time and so were the weapons, graphics, sound, physics, and enemies. The game has your usual weapons like machine guns with grenade launchers, pistols, revolvers etc. but HL has some weapons up it's sleeve that were never seen before. Those such weapons happen to be a laser guided rocket launcher (you guide it with your mouse!) I remember people buzzing about this weapons back in the day and it's still pretty cool. You also have the Bee Gun which is a weird slimy thing that shoots killer bees, you have some strange electricity guns, mines, laser mines, satchel charges etc.

The enemies were also something never seen before like the Head Crabs, Head Crab Zombies, the Ichthyosaur, the Vortigaunts etc. The game also had HUGE bosses which was amazing back in the day and seemed very epic. The game was dark, creepy, and very hard as well. Most shooters back in the late 90's were just run & gun nonsense in dark tunnels, military complexes etc. Half-Life is not innocent and does do this, but there are other places to see like climbing a HUGE canyon and looking out over the *ugly* vista that looks like the Grand Canyon. Today it looks like someone slapped a low-res JPEG image in the background, but in the late 90's things like this seemed like you were staring over a GrindLift in Gears of War 2. Half-Life was just so real and so amazing back in it's day that it really kind of shocks you how such an old game can still make that kind of impact.

The game also consists of a lot of maze like halls that you can get easily lost in and I found this the main problem with HL. Some of the puzzles were a bit confusing to do and navigating the endless halls calls for a much needed walkthrough. While the level design is excellent and you pretty much know where to go there are those occasional moments that make you wander around the whole area a few times and look in every nook and cranny wondering what switch you missed or what do you need to go through. Some neat things back in the day was being able to have the Blue Shift men help you and ask scientists to open doors for you. While this is standard these days this kind of AI was unknown to the late 90's PC gamers. This added to the realism and made you fee like you really are stuck in Black Mesa trying to fight off the alien invasion.

You're probably wondering what the story is right? Well it's simple really, Gordan Freeman (that's you) arrives in Anomalous Hazards as a regular employee and an experiment goes awry and Gordan must escape the facility and figure out the source of the alien invasion. The story, as I've already said, isn't told through cut scenes, but rather in real time while you play. This helps add to the experience, but of course may bore most younger PC gamers who are used to FEAR, Crysis, CoD etc. Half-Life is for the hardcore old school PC shooter fans only and really takes cunning skill to finish. The game will give you less and less health as you go and you'll have to figure out how to take out a room of 10 bad guys with only 2 health. While this isn't impossible it can be done and requires precise skill (thus only for hardcore fans).

Most of you have probably played HL2 already and these games are pretty much completely different besides the content. You still have your hazard suit, most of the weapons are the same, but there is more stuff in HL1. About 40% of the weapons and enemies in HL1 aren't in HL2. HL2 is more realistic while HL1 is more of a sci-fi type game. Thankfully you can play HL2 without even touching HL1 (which I did), but HL1 explains a lot of things that aren't explained in HL2 and there are bits in HL2 that are for fans of HL1 that you normally wouldn't know about unless you played this game.

Now of course HL1 has a lot of flaws like floaty physics, being able to run 100mph, cheap deaths, poor graphics but these are flaws seen from age. If you were to warp back to 1998 the game was almost flawless. Now when it comes to upgrades and mods there is an endless ocean. There are a ton of amazing multiplayer and singe player mods available and I have spend hours and hours on most of them. You must go to FilePlanet.com and download these mods because they are super fun. HL1 also has a free hi-def pack that you can download to update the graphics a little bit. If you want to go even further pick up Half-Life: Source which uses HL2's engine to make things look more modern. I highly recommend the Source version for people who just can't stand "old graphics", but old school shooter fan should just get the hi-def pack just for nostalgia's sake.
